comment: I took her Sociology of Violence class and enjoyed it. Beware, this class is only graded by 3 in-person tests (all curved)1 final, attendance, participation and 1-2 assignments. So if you struggle with going to class be prepared to not do well. Attendance is important because she is very lecture-heavy, but they are interesting. Would take her again
This class was easy you had like 1 thing to do every week

Dr. Ralston-Coley is a great professor that makes sure students are learning in a safe, judgement- free space. There were 2 assignments and 3 exams for the semester, but someones she gives extra credit. You MUST engage in class discussion if you don't want to be bored the entire class although it is not required whatsoever.
I gave the least amount of effort I have ever given in a class and I got a B.
drops lowest test grade and lowest quiz grade. gave extra credit for attending class. be ready to take notes. all tests are open note and online
great teacher. online tests no camera or lock down, pop quizzes but she tells you when they are. no homework. makes lectures interesting. easy you. dont rlly need to study

She is so sweet and genuinely wants you to succeed in her course. She has "pop" quizzes but always hints when they will be during class. Her lectures are always interesting and they are more like a discussion which is nice for us to genuinely learn for our own values rather than for the grade. Her exams are online and open notes!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: The professor herself is knowledgeable and makes the discussions interesting. But she is an extremely late grader, the test are open note but there are more questions than minutes available. Some of the tests questions came from the PowerPoint/lecture some did not. Attendance isn't required but I would go to class as she doesn't require reading.

Participation was not mandatory, but she would give details used in tests in her lectures. Very understanding, gave extensions on tests to students. Her lectures were interesting and she encouraged discussions about the lectures. Really down to earth and personable professor, I would highly suggest taking her.

Love her as a person but she takes FOREVER to give grades back. The exams were okay. She gave us a 'study guide' but it was literally bullet points of each topic. She is funny, but basically reads off the power points. Didn't learn as much as I thought I would.

The work load is super simple, and very light. She is not a harsh grader. She was super easy to talk to, and makes jokes during lectures to keep it interesting. While attendance isn't mandatory, you miss a lot of important details for exams if you skip. 10/10 would recommend her class
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I really enjoyed her lectures, she makes everything interesting. She was funny, which made it easy to remember some stuff. The only thing is she grades the Activities hard. I wish the final was worth more, but overall it was a very easy class. Its great to take to boost your GPA or if you're interested in the subject, she's a great choice.

Prof Coley is great. Not only is she funny, but she makes her class interesting. I really enjoy learning in her class. Her quizzes and tests are all open notes, but they have a shorter than normal time, so you still need to look over them. Typically it will be a 20 question quiz w/ 12 mins. She does "pop quizzes" but tells you about them. 10/10 rec

Save yourself the time/unnecessary stress. Don't let her fool you. She seems laid back but is very particular and horrible at making instructions clear. Gave a 72 questioned test during the pandemic and claims you don't need a book BUT YOU DO if you want to pass. She is very unqualified to be a professor & talks about her personal life too often.

SOCI 4432 was one of the hardest classes I've taken in my college career, and Professor Ralston-Coley did not make it any easier whatsoever. There was a significant amount of difficulty for her with online learning and understanding how OwlExpress works. She assigned some of the hardest pop quizzes I've ever taken and tests were not much easier.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Shes a solid choice, offers many opportunities to help your grade, just pay attention to powerpoints, go over notes (if you take any), and youll be fine
rating_tags: Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class was an online class. I emailed her several times throughout the semester and she never would respond. She only responded to two emails and this was on the last week of class. Her grading was random and didn't go by instructions or rubric. I'm not sure if this was due to the virus, but I would never take her again. I taught myself.

She is one of my favorite professors! She is supportive and helped me with getting accepted to graduate school. She sparks interesting discussions during her lecture and really makes you think. If you're an interactive learner, she will also be your favorite. Lowest (online) exam grade dropped, attendance is extra credit, and one easy paper.

this class was a joke. Her lectures are useless. Everything is from the book that she said you, "don't need." BUY IT. Her study guides are not helpful she ask questions not on the guide. Doesn't respond to emails, never clear what you are being graded on, gave a 72 question test in an hour with short answer, all exams online (drops lowest). So hard
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Tough grader

comment: HORRIBLE. Exams are 50 questions and "open note" yet she only gives you 50 minutes to take the exam. Study guides are completely usless and dont reflect the exam. Doesnt even lecture in class. Unaccomodating to students needs. Randomly gave us a 72 question exam with one hour to complete it with no warning and not willing to listen to our concerns.
A real gem. Loved her way of teaching. She was also so kind. Would definitely take her again. Tests are really doable if you keep up with the lectures. Films are fun and discussions interesting.

one of my favorite professors. she is hilarious. she tries to make sociology easy and fun to learn, but her tests can be a bit hard, but if you study for them enough you should get a good grade. couple quizzes throughout the semester, she drops the lowest one, and the same goes for the test as well. It would be a mistake not to take her class!

I lover her. She is very understanding of her students and relates to us all the time. Her lectures are engaging and I always enjoy coming to class. She always tries her best to make the material easy to learn for her students. Her tests can be hard and her study guides aren't amazing but she will take recommendations and go over material with you.

This professor is my probably my favorite professor of all time already and I am just a freshman. She is a great teacher. Very chill and very caring. She makes you and your peers more comfortable in the classroom. Her lectures are pretty heavy, but they are accessible outside of class which is great. She does give some extra credit but not much.

TAKE HER for anything. this is my second time taking her and its always an easy A. attendance is not mandatory and all the notes are posted before the class period. You don't even need the book. got an A on her test with just the notes. One paper for the semester which is not unbearable. Take her, you won't regret it.

One of my favorite professors at KSU. I had two classes with her this semester. Three test and a final, which is optional. An easy paper, really lenient on the paper's grade. As long as you show knowledge on the subject and use theories you learned from class then you're fine. Overall, she's a really sweet professor who loves her students. EASY A/B

She's super laid back & extremely nice. She's passionate about the subjects she teaches. Had her for 2 different classes & enjoyed both. Her lectures are all posted but you'll want to go to class cause stuff she says in person will be on exams. 4 exams total, she drops 1. Exams can be a little difficult & tricky, definitely need to study. Take her!

Show up, she posts her lectures but likes to say things in class that end up on the test. You need to pay attention and take notes, her study guides are not good. I made a B on every test (there are 4, the final is optional- and she takes the questions from the other tests). Her final paper is not hard, just annoying. You don't need the book!
rating_tags: Tests? Not many--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: One of my favorite professors, down to earth. Tests were pretty easy just study the material like any other class and you got it. Pretty laid back, lectures everyday, kinda boring. She really gets into criminology, wants you to think like one. Group discussions usually. Just tests movies, and papers on movies you watch, not bad movies either.

Shes a bit of a hippie. Gives not so pop quizes. She says shes not trying to trick you on her tests but i found the wording to be a bit confusing. Im happy with my high B in her class. I look forward to taking her for a criminology class. Loved the movies she shows.

She is an awesome, very laid back professor. Teaches very interesting lectures. Gives 4 not so pop quizzes and drops 2. No surprises in this class... another reason why she's amazing! 3 tests based on powerpoint notes and the option to opt out of final. She inspires me to be a sociology major

Take her, you wont regret it. Her class is VERY SIMPLE. No unnecessary work. 3 test and an optional final. She gives four "pop" quizzes, but ony 2 of them count towards your final grade. She generally will drop hints or straight up tell you when to expect a quiz. She was very lenient on her test (if no one makes a 100, then she curves the grade).
